verses.verse: Then came<WH935> all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to David<WH1732> to Hebron,<WH2275> and spoke,<WH559> saying,<WH559> Behold,<WH2005> we are your bone<WH6106> and your flesh.<WH1320>

Also<WH1571> in time<WH865> <WH8543> past,<WH8032> when Saul<WH7586> was king<WH4428> over<WH5921> us, you were<WH1961> he that led<WH3318> out and brought<WH935> in Israel:<WH3478> and the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to you, You shall feed<WH7462> my people<WH5971> Israel,<WH3478> and you shall be a captain<WH5057> over<WH5921> Israel.<WH3478>

So all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> to Hebron;<WH2275> and king<WH4428> David<WH1732> made<WH3772> a league<WH1285> with them in Hebron<WH2275> before<WH6440> the LORD:<WH3068> and they anointed<WH4886> David<WH1732> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel.<WH3478>
David<WH1732> was thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign,<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> forty<WH705> years.<WH8141>

In Hebron<WH2275> he reigned<WH4427> over<WH5921> Judah<WH3063> seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> and six<WH8337> months:<WH2320> and in Jerusalem<WH3389> he reigned<WH4427> thirty<WH7970> and three<WH7969> years<WH8141> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> and Judah.<WH3063>

And the king<WH4428> and his men<WH582> went<WH3212> to Jerusalem<WH3389> to the Jebusites,<WH2983> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land:<WH776> which spoke<WH559> to David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> Except<WH3588> <WH518> you take<WH5493> away<WH5493> the blind<WH5787> and the lame,<WH6455> you shall not come<WH935> in here: thinking,<WH559> David<WH1732> cannot<WH3808> come<WH935> in here.
Nevertheless David<WH1732> took<WH3920> the strong<WH4686> hold<WH4686> of Zion:<WH6726> the same<WH1931> is the city<WH5892> of David.<WH1732>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> on that day,<WH3117> Whoever gets<WH5060> up to the gutter,<WH6794> and smites<WH5221> the Jebusites,<WH2983> and the lame<WH6455> and the blind <WH5787>that are hated<WH8130> of David's<WH1732> soul,<WH5315> he shall be chief and captain. Why<WH5921> <WH3651> they said,<WH559> The blind<WH5787> and the lame<WH6455> shall not come<WH935> into<WH413> the house.<WH1004>

So David<WH1732> dwelled<WH3427> in the fort,<WH4686> and called<WH7121> it the city<WH5892> of David.<WH1732> And David<WH1732> built<WH1129> round<WH5439> about from Millo<WH4407> and inward.<WH1004>
And David<WH1732> went<WH3212> on, and grew great,<WH1419> and the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635> was with him.

And Hiram<WH2438> king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David,<WH1732> and cedar<WH730> trees,<WH6086> and carpenters,<WH2796> <WH6086> and masons:<WH2796> <WH68> and they built<WH1129> David<WH1732> an house.<WH1004>

And David<WH1732> perceived<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> had established<WH3559> him king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> and that he had exalted<WH5375> his kingdom<WH4467> for his people<WH5971> Israel's<WH3478> sake.<WH5668>

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> him more<WH5750> concubines<WH6370> and wives<WH802> out of Jerusalem,<WH3389> after<WH310> he was come<WH935> from Hebron:<WH2275> and there were yet<WH5750> sons<WH1121> and daughters<WH1323> born<WH3205> to David.<WH1732>
And these<WH428> be the names<WH8034> of those that were born<WH3209> to him in Jerusalem;<WH3389> Shammuah,<WH8051> and Shobab,<WH7727> and Nathan,<WH5416> and Solomon,<WH8010>
Ibhar<WH2984> also, and Elishua,<WH474> and Nepheg,<WH5298> and Japhia,<WH3309>
And Elishama,<WH476> and Eliada,<WH450> and Eliphalet.<WH467>

But when the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> that they had anointed<WH4886> David<WH1732> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> all<WH3605> the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH5927> up to seek<WH1245> David;<WH1732> and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it, and went<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the hold.<WH4686>
The Philistines<WH6430> also came<WH935> and spread<WH5203> themselves in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim.<WH7497>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the LORD,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> Shall I go<WH5927> up to the Philistines?<WH6430> will you deliver<WH5414> them into my hand?<WH3027> And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Go<WH5927> up: for I will doubtless deliver<WH5414> the Philistines<WH6430> into your hand.<WH3027>

And David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Baalperazim,<WH1188> and David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them there,<WH8033> and said,<WH559> The LORD<WH3068> has broken<WH6555> forth on my enemies<WH341> before<WH6440> me, as the breach<WH6556> of waters.<WH4325> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Baalperazim.<WH1188>
And there<WH8033> they left<WH5800> their images,<WH6091> and David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> burned<WH5375> them.
And the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH5927> up yet<WH5750> again,<WH3254> and spread<WH5203> themselves in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim.<WH7497>

And when David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the LORD,<WH3068> he said,<WH559> You shall not go<WH5927> up; but fetch a compass<WH5437> behind<WH310> them, and come<WH935> on them over<WH4136> against<WH4136> the mulberry<WH1057> trees.

And let it be, when you hear<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of a going<WH6807> in the tops<WH7218> of the mulberry<WH1057> trees, that then<WH227> you shall bestir<WH2782> yourself: for then<WH227> shall the LORD<WH3068> go<WH3318> out before<WH6440> you, to smite<WH5221> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines.<WH6430>
And David<WH1732> did<WH6213> so,<WH3651> as the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> him; and smote<WH5221> the Philistines<WH6430> from Geba<WH1387> until<WH5704> you come<WH935> to Gazer.<WH1507>
